source.citation: Andersson, B. 1996. Harvesting Coastal Second-Growth Forests: Loader-Forwarding of Hand- and Machine-Felled Timber. FERIC TN-261.
notes: Six-week study (January–April 1994) on Vancouver Island comparing loader-forwarding of feller-bunched vs. hand-felled stems across Buckley Bay (blocks B1–B3) and Nanoose (block N1).
Detailed timing spans 7 studies (5 mechanically bunched, 2 hand-felled) with piece sizes 0.8–1.48 m³, forwarding distances 60–180 m, slopes from −20 % (favourable) to +10 % (adverse).

regression.slope_multiplier_rule: Uphill productivity reduced by ~30% per 100% slope (≈3% per 10%); downhill boosts 15% per 100% (≈1.5% per 10%) with clamps [0.6, 1.15].
